channel.title: BBC News | World | UK Edition
channel.description: Updated every minute of every day

item.title: US pulls out of Saudi Arabia
item.description: The United States says virtually all its troops, except some training personnel, are to be withdrawn from Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Sars 'a long-term epidemic'
item.description: The outbreak of the Sars virus in China is a grave and long-term problem, Prime Minister Wen Jiabao says.

item.title: PM rejects Mid-East violence
item.description: The Palestinian prime minister-designate says there is no military solution to the Isralei conflict, as he faces a crucial vote.

item.title: Charges over Serb PM murder
item.description: Serbian ultra-nationalist Vojislav Seselj and 44 others are charged over the killing of PM Zoran Djindjic.

item.title: 'Anti-war' four stress euro-role
item.description: Four anti-war EU leaders end a summit reaffirming their commitment to Nato - but seeking closer European ties.

item.title: Vajpayee 'not to go to Pakistan'
item.description: India's prime minister is unlikely to visit Pakistan for talks in the near future, despite an invitation from his counterpart.

item.title: Croat 'war crimes' general dies
item.description: The former head of the Croatian army, seen as a national hero but indicted by the war crimes tribunal, dies.

item.title: Militant killed in Gaza attack
item.description: A Palestinian militant dies in a strike by Israeli helicopter gunships in Gaza, while two others are reported killed in the West Bank.

item.title: Blair arrives for Russia talks
item.description: The UK prime minister is holding his first meeting with President Putin since the start of the Iraq war.

item.title: Iraqis killed in anti-US protest
item.description: US troops open fire on demonstrators in the town of Falluja, killing at least 13 people according to witnesses.

item.title: Iraqi antiquities summit held
item.description: Museum experts meet in London to discuss how to help restore the looted cultural heritage of Iraq.

item.title: US anger at war crimes threat
item.description: The US warns Belgium not to proceed with a possible war crimes case against Iraq war commander Tommy Franks.

item.title: Wimbledon ups prize money
item.description: This year's Wimbledon men's singles champion will receive £575,000.

item.title: Kiwis bat out Colombo draw
item.description: New Zealand and Sri Lanka draw the first Test, despite three late wickets for Muttiah Muralitharan.

item.title: Fears for Nigerian oil hostages
item.description: Negotiations are under way to free foreign oil workers - including 50 Britons - held on rigs off the Nigerian coast.
